alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 7:08PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cherokee County through 800 PM CDT... At 708 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Little River Canyon National Preserve, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cedar Bluff, Little River Canyon National Preserve, Gaylesville, Cornwall Furnace Park, Blanche, Little River Falls, Western Weiss Lake, Eastern Weiss Lake, Fullerton, New Moon, Broomtown, Chesterfield and Little River Canyon NP. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
